member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeDefaultConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration for accessing Amazon BedrockRuntime service

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by BedrockRuntime

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Endpoints.BedrockRuntimeEndpointParameters
member.summary: Contains parameters used for resolving BedrockRuntime endpoints Parameters can be sourced from client config and service operations Used by internal BedrockRuntimeEndpointProvider and BedrockRuntimeEndpointResolver Can be used by custom EndpointProvider, see ClientConfig.EndpointProvider

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockRuntimeEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon BedrockRuntime endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of BedrockRuntimeEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockRuntimeEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for BedrockRuntimeEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Internal.AmazonBedrockRuntimeEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon BedrockRuntime endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for BedrockRuntime service requests. Collects values for BedrockRuntimeEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses BedrockRuntimeEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the InvokeModel operation. Invokes the specified Bedrock model to run inference using the input provided in the request body. You use InvokeModel to run inference for text models, image models, and embedding models.
For more information, see Run inference in the Bedrock User Guide.
For example requests, see Examples (after the Errors section).

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest.Accept
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accept.
The desired MIME type of the inference body in the response. The default value is application/json.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Input data in the format specified in the content-type request header. To see the format and content of this field for different models, refer to Inference parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the input data in the request. The default value is application/json.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest.ModelId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelId.
Identifier of the model.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InvokeModel operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelResponse.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Inference response from the model in the format specified in the content-type header field. To see the format and content of this field for different models, refer to Inference parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelResponse.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the inference result.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the InvokeModelWithResponseStream operation. Invoke the specified Bedrock model to run inference using the input provided. Return the response in a stream.
For more information, see Run inference in the Bedrock User Guide.
For an example request and response, see Examples (after the Errors section).

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest.Accept
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accept.
The desired MIME type of the inference body in the response. The default value is application/json.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Inference input in the format specified by the content-type. To see the format and content of this field for different models, refer to Inference parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the input data in the request. The default value is application/json.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest.ModelId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelId.
Id of the model to invoke using the streaming request.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InvokeModelWithResponseStream operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamResponse.Body
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Body.
Inference response from the model in the format specified by Content-Type. To see the format and content of this field for different models, refer to Inference parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamResponse.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
The MIME type of the inference result.

member.name: T:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing BedrockRuntime
Describes the API operations for running inference using Bedrock models.

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient.InvokeModelAsync(Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Invokes the specified Bedrock model to run inference using the input provided in the request body. You use InvokeModel to run inference for text models, image models, and embedding models.
For more information, see Run inference in the Bedrock User Guide.
For example requests, see Examples (after the Errors section).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeModel service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the InvokeModel service method, as returned by BedrockRuntime.
member.exception: The request is denied because of missing access permissions.
An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.
The request failed due to an error while processing the model.
The model specified in the request is not ready to serve inference requests.
The request took too long to process. Processing time exceeded the model timeout length.
The specified resource ARN was not found. Check the ARN and try your request again.
The number of requests exceeds the service quota. Resubmit your request later.
The number of requests exceeds the limit. Resubmit your request later.
Input validation failed. Check your request parameters and retry the request.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InvokeModel Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamAsync(Amazon.BedrockRuntime.Model.InvokeModelWithResponseStreamRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Invoke the specified Bedrock model to run inference using the input provided. Return the response in a stream.
For more information, see Run inference in the Bedrock User Guide.
For an example request and response, see Examples (after the Errors section).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the InvokeModelWithResponseStream service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the InvokeModelWithResponseStream service method, as returned by BedrockRuntime.
member.exception: The request is denied because of missing access permissions.
An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.
The request failed due to an error while processing the model.
The model specified in the request is not ready to serve inference requests.
An error occurred while streaming the response.
The request took too long to process. Processing time exceeded the model timeout length.
The specified resource ARN was not found. Check the ARN and try your request again.
The number of requests exceeds the service quota. Resubmit your request later.
The number of requests exceeds the limit. Resubmit your request later.
Input validation failed. Check your request parameters and retry the request.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for InvokeModelWithResponseStream Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.BedrockRuntime.AmazonBedrockRuntimeClient.DetermineServiceOperationEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.AmazonWebServiceRequest)
member.summary: Returns the endpoint that will be used for a particular request.
member.param: Request for the desired service operation.
member.returns: The resolved endpoint for the given request.
